reviews.title: DO NOT RENT HERE
reviews.text: Changed address on me 3 times before I even got there. Filty tiny condo, no amenities that are advertised. "Luxury 2 bedroom condo" is a 1 bedroom with a curtain put up across the eat in area of kitchen to make "bedroom" owners of property do not respond at all

reviews.title: DO NOT BOOK AT THIS HOTEL OR DUNDAS SUITES (SAME HOTEL) - NOT SAFE
reviews.text: This was a terrifying experience. The room pictures are lovely, but the construction is NOT finished and there are wires hanging out, venting not connected, furniture not put together properly. There is no hotel front or lobby, instead you pull up to a boarded-up building covered in graffiti with a paper hand written sign directing you to another door where you go up stairs and enter a dim room covered in boxes and papers. They photocopy your credit card and then walk you outside, around the block corner to a gravel path into an unfinished courtyard. The outside of the building looks to be falling off in spots, and there is insulation hanging out and backer -board everywhere. The room I was given was not the room I booked, and I cannot believe that this place has passed final building inspections. Despite purchasing a non-refundable room through Expedia, we refused to stay here. If you are staying for the PanAm games, PLEASE DO NOT BOOK AT THIS HOTEL even though the price appears good. It is wildly misrepresented on the booking sites, and is a hazard.

reviews.title: The Worst 3-star Condo Ever Stayed
reviews.text: When we were booking Downtown West Toronto 3-star Condos on Hotwire, it actually showed the name "Dundas Apartments & Suites", but it is owned by the same owner so the front desk gave us " Urban Living Suites", not sure if they are honest there or not...The room #245 has no windows, no phones to call the front desk, and the mattress is super hard; Then we saw broken tap handle and bugs in the washroom, plus hair in the towels too... You can find some dirty cheap hair products pics I posted; the worst are probably ink/hair in the sheets and only 5 channels on TV (u can get that for free anyway)! And they charged us $165 per night (after taxes)... Definitely overpricy and no way it's 3-star!

reviews.title: Worst booking experience ever!
reviews.text: Booked with this "hotel" through hotels.com. I am military and about 2 days prior to check in date had to cancel due to military orders. Hotel does not have a clear cancellation policy and refuses to even provide me with any type of policy regarding when I would have had to cancel to receive my deposit back. Worst experience I've had with a hotel trying to get this resolved. Spend the extra $ and book with a REPUTABLE hotel.

reviews.title: Recommended by Hotels.com but So Bad We Couldn't Stay
reviews.text: I am a college student on a budget. This was recommended to me after calling hotels.com. Got there and they first of all didn't have the hotels.com reservation, and then between the construction and the room itself, we couldn't stay. Was NOTHING like the photos on hotels.com!The place wouldn't refund my money and hasn't responded to numerous attempts to contact them. Hotels.com has also been contacted 5 times and twice promised to contact me within 72 hours. That was 11 days or 264 hours ago. I have called and emailed, and nothing. Shame on the place and shame on HOTELS.COM. They will never have my business again!!!

reviews.title: Positives and Negatives
reviews.text: Once I found out where to check in, it took 10 minutes for someone to greet me, after I called both numbers on the door.Positives: Free parking, walking distance to Toronto Western Hospital, walking distance to many restaurants, kind ownersNegatives: Bed was hard as a rock (and I like firm mattresses,) chilly room (could have used another blanket,) step into stairwell is loose wood, light in kitchen is full of bugs, handrail is about knee level the closer you get to the topWould I stay again? Yes, if they change the beds - the room was super quiet, even with the streetcars going by, Tim Horton's across the road and McDonalds next door. To be fair, my room didn't have a window, so rooms with Windows may be slightly noisier.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: I completely agree with the previous reviews and wish I'd read them before booking.   I booked through hotwire as all I was looking for was a place to sleep for the night and didn't need any frills.   Hotwire claims that all their rooms are clean and that's all that mattered to me. Check in was a long and painful process.   The practice of photo copying your credit card and drivers licence is terrifying to me.   The area is a little sketchy.   The construction comments in previous posts still stand. I've added pictures of the moldy shower curtain,  the disgusting air return,  the ripped sheets,  the towel with holes in it and the counter top which just shows a lack of attention or disregard for detail. The bed was hard as a rock.   I like a firm mattress but this wasn't firm it was hard.   In reading one of the other reviews maybe it was just a box spring. I can't believe hotwire rated this in the same star rating as a Sheraton or Radisson.

reviews.title: Under Construction - Should Not Be Open For Business
reviews.text: The front of the hotel is completely boarded/ tarped up. The guest registration is actually next door in a walk up with only a sheet of paper in the window to indicate it.. It looks under construction as well.Our room was around the side of the building down a hall where the drywall and floors weren't even finished yet.. The room is basic.  Each queen sized bed had only 1 pillow. The room did have a fridge, half stove, TV and a table with 3 chairs.  Staff brought more pillows and a blanket and provided bottles of water.

reviews.title: Absolute Worst Experience Iâ€™ve ever had in my entire life
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked through Hotwire and got this hotel for $120/night. We were staying for 5 nights. First of all, shame on Hotwire for even having this hotel as an option. The day we arrived the address was advertised wrong so we couldnâ€™t find the place and after calling 3 times the lady finally was able to tell us where it was. We entered the â€œhotelâ€ through a coffee shop and had to wait an hour for the room to be ready. Then the lady had to take us through a sketchy gate to get to the room. This room had not one window. Toilet didnâ€™t work and no hot water in shower. Bed was horrible and uncomfortable. There were hair and dust all over everything. There was a kitchenette which was nice. But it honestly felt like a jail cell. We only went to the room to sleep and found every way possible to avoid staying in there. No air conditioning and no room service. Not once were out toilet paper filled or bed made. We had to buy toilet paper cause thereâ€™s no phone in the room to call front desk(there is no front desk). This was a scary excuse for a hotel room. I have stayed at over a hundred hotels around the world. Iâ€™ve stayed at plenty in GTA but Iâ€™ve stayed at hotels in third world countries for a third of the price of this hotel and nothing, NOTHING compared to how terrible this place was.Do NOT stay here! Iâ€™ve never left a negative review for anything in my life. But this needed to be said. If you have a trip coming up planning to stay here, CANCEL it!! And Hotwire, shame on you for having this as a â€œhotelâ€ option associated with the same level of quality as Sheraton and Delta Chelsea.

reviews.title: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER
reviews.text: So a few friends and myself stayed here 2 weeks ago. The place is under renovations and we were told that we had to walk around the building and use the back door (which is very sketchy). Upon check out, the front desk person checked our room and said we were good to go. A few days later I noticed they charged me 100$ extra on my visa. I called them 4 times in the two weeks since and they said that it must have been a mistake and their manager would fix this (the manager never called us back any of the times). Today I get an email saying they charged me 100$ because we were too loud that night (which we weren't even there from 7pm-3am). I am contacting Visa tomorrow about this unauthorized transaction (fraud) because at this point they are making excuses

reviews.title: The worst!!
reviews.text: the hotel itself is just kind of sketch Dont waste your money or time. hotel been under construction for 3 years neighbors was telling me. the rooms are real small they also don't have no phones in the rooms. i had to go outside on the roof which was unsafe with boards on it to get to my room once i got to my room i had to step down a whole foot to get in the room. as small and the AC was blasting the whole time with no controls to turn it off. It claimed to have baseboard heaters in the room, but that wasn't the case.You go into one storefront (no sign) to check in and then go down the street to a nondescript door that takes you to a little area with a long staircase. After climbing the stairs and found myself on the roof. there are also no 24hr person at the front desk its a sing on the door that say please call.. the parking is terrible they had me park in this lot which i got blocked in and they didn't know who car it was, when parking enforcement was called they gonna tell me that this lot is not register and there nothing they can do.. cut the long story short when i went to get my money back they was giving me the running round acting like they didnt know who the manager was, DONT STAY HERE!

reviews.title: Do your homework before spending BIG BUCKS HERE
reviews.text: We stayed in the 'superior' room and i must say that it was quite tolerable. there is a large kitchen and a very large bathroom with 2 bedrooms and 2 large TVs. The reception staff is very friendly and eager to please. Why it didn't get more than 2 stars ?The apartment layout is just plain strange.. There is NO living room or den.. so if you want to relax and read, you either lie on one of the beds or sit on a hard kitchen chair. Bizarre. There is a large fridge (probably irrelevant for most people) but it blocks 1/2 the entrance to the bathroom. would make a good situation comedy set. The walls are in need of a new paint job. The bathroom fan sounds like a 747 taking off.. The walls are paper thin so you hear other 747s taking off.There are no face towels in the bathroom (HELLO>> THIS IS NOT EUROPE)They give you slivers of soap, the kind your parents used to get in all hotels.The shampoos are God knows what made with what...I didn't try the stove.. but the light didn't work....one bedroom had no table lamps and the other bedroom had only one. The beds were large enough and mostly comfortable which is nice.. There are windows to open but this room had central heating and cooling .. so you have to call the staff when you want to change the temperature...you can get cheap on-street parking, but you may have to walk a while to bet back to your apartment.

reviews.title: Is this up to fire code? Stay AWAY!!!
reviews.text: Booked a room to see a Blue Jay's ALCS game. Hotwire compared this place (2.5 star) to a Best Western, Holiday Inn Express, Clarion which we thought was reasonable. Don't be fooled! It is NOT comparable.Like a previous review, our room didn't have a view. We were up a flight of dirty stairs/hallway. Our room DID NOT have a window (is that even legal? Up to fire code?). It had a skylight that was about 15-20 feet up into the ceiling with no way of getting out if there was a fire. The worse part is that I didn't even think of this until the next morning...or I would of put up an argument.  The shower door was broken, couldn't open it without it falling over. The bathroom sink base of made of plywood. Tried to check in at 3:00pm but the room wasn't ready. When we came back after the game (8pm), we were given this room. With an exhausted 7 year old son and my mother who is a senior, I was at a loss. I had paid $125 for this room that was non-refundable and my other option was to lose $125 and try to book sold out or unaffordable rooms in other hotels, I felt stuck and we stayed the night. Once I contacted Hotwire (the next day), they told me that there wasn't much they could do to help me as I didn't call them at 8pm for help (didn't think they'd help me so didn't call). I really think they should not rate this place in the same category as the hotels named above in my review. It is false advertisement. If you are a mother traveling with a child/children or a single woman, do NOT rent a room here, you will NOT feel safe. Everything about it gave me the creeps. I am really hoping that Hotwire lowers the star rating on this place so that no one gets rolled a bad card like we did. If you happen to get this room from a Hotwire purchase and you feel unsafe in your room, call Hotwire, they say they are available 24 hrs/day and they have received a formal complaint from me so it shouldn't be a surprise to them. They have told me that they WOULD OF HELPED ME should I have called on the spot at 8pm. I'd love to hear from someone if to see if they actually would.

reviews.title: AVOID A NO GO
reviews.text: Very rude receptionist ,basic ,and Filthy room,And Got Stung $163. Cad,We had an absolutely awful experience here,it was like we were an inconvenience for turning up,the receptionist has absolutely no manners or people skills ,an unfinished hotel is very understated.

reviews.title: Not a hotel.. This is a budget establishment
reviews.text: I booked this place because it was TIFF, and most hotels were booked out, and those that weren't were beyond my budget. This place is a hostel. It is not like renting a serviced apartment. It is a room, sparsely furnished (and badly too), with an air conditioning system that made a huge ruckus, no windows, and dim yellow light that made the place feel a little sleazy.Now if it was reasonably priced (I.e sub CAD 100, then I might have given it a better star rating, but for 150 CAD/night, I truly expected more.Pros : It was a bed. Roof. Toilet. Cons : Everything else. The check in was hard as I could barely find the place. The corridors are dark and dimly lit. The latch of the door was non-existent, an there was only a twist lock (being a lone female travelling, this did not make me feel secure)The blankets were thin. The air conditioning was 25 years old, yellowing and made a huge ruckus. No windows. Poorly furnished, everything was really old. Toiletries were cheap and terrible. Go in with your eyes open and you won't be too disappointed. If all you want is a place to stay, and you aren't going to spend any considerable time in your room, then this should be okay. But I think you will find a better located, nicer place on AirBnB for cheaper.

reviews.title: Horrible customer service
reviews.text: My friends and I booked a room last-minute when we missed a connecting flight into Montreal. Our first flight then got cancelled. We cancelled our reservation, after it was reserved for 90 minutes. We called and spoke with Molly and Michael who both offered partial refunds. We also spoke with Rhysa, who claimed the partial refund wouldn't happen. She was extremely rude and unwilling to help. I asked to speak with Ping, the owner, and Rhysa refused. After a terrible 2 days of traveling, this was extremely disappointing and frustrating.

reviews.title: Hostel not hotel
reviews.text: This was an emergency booking on the long weekend while a family member was in hospital. Everywhere else close to hospital was full.  This is a hostel not a hotel,while sitting on the bed you can touch the wall on all sides.  Up a flight a stairs with non compliant railing. Our room had no window which I thought was against building code. Folding desk on wall.  Kitchenette but gross sponge from who knows how long ago and no dish soap touched none of it. Had a rolling pin cause I might need to hit someone? Kettle, toaster, two burners with fridge under like in a camper. Only good thing was good  toilet paper and a couple of good restaurants nearby.  No sound proofing, terrible bed. Air conditioning controls outside the room.  There are renovations going on hopefully will improve.  Not the worst area of toronto. Got to give the guy credit probably makes more money this way than as rooming house

reviews.title: Yuck!
reviews.text: Urban Living Suites on Dundas St in Toronto is far from a 3 star stay.  I will be generous in giving it one and a half stars.  I'm not even sure where to begin.  In an effort to save time and for easy reading, let's do this bullet style:- Located down the street from low income housing (although the area seemed safe)- Room was FILTHY- Bed was broken.  When I sat on one side, the other side came up like a seesaw.  I almost fell to the ground.  They had to put a few pieces of wood on one side to prevent what could have been a horrible fall.- The mattress was the hardest thing I've ever slept on.  I don't think it had one spring inside it.- TV would not swivel.  As a result, you can't watch it while laying in bed.- The lobby is a very small office that you have to walk outside the building to get to.- One washcloth had dried blood on it.  Two other washcloths had what looked like pubic hair and other body fluids. ðŸ’©- No alarm clock- No telephone in room so I couldn't call the front desk.  Therefore, I had to walk back outside to reach them.- No cable (appx 5 channels worked)- Microwave and stove was old and dirty- Mold in bathroom crevices- Visible mold and dirt on shower curtain- Dirty baseboards- Sheets were stained as if they didn't use enough bleach- No carpet.  They came and mopped the floors while I was there at my request.  They used the same mop in the bathroom as they did in the bedroom.  Yuck.- I was constantly coughing there but when I would leave, I was fine.  Weird.Positive:- It appeared that renovations were being made in the "office/lobby" and hopefully will make its way to the rooms.  Unfortunately, this added no value to my experience.- Internet was fast- Most of the staff was friendly but this one lady.....not so much.  She had an attitude out this world.- They were attentive to my needsThe hotel definitely put a damper on my vacation.  Every time I was done sightseeing I dreaded coming back to the room.  I actually stayed out longer to avoid the somber feeling of returning there and in hopes of being so exhausted that I would just crash when I got there.  OSHA should definitely come to inspect this hotel for themselves.  I do not recommend it to anyone for reasons including health, safety and peace of mind.

reviews.title: Terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I did not look at the reviews before booking this through Hotels.com. It was the worst place I have ever seen. We were supposed to stay for 4 nights today! We looked at it first and it smelt really bad and doesn't look like the pictures they have online. It is in a bad neighbourhood and we have 3 small children so it was a definite a hell no!! The lady at the reception desk (if you could even call it that) was a complete goof! She said she didn't care if we had small kids and didn't want to stay there she wasn't giving us any kind of refund. Hotels.com or whoever else that is advertising this place should take them off. It makes them look bad! Why would they advertise this place!?

reviews.title: Blind booking thru Hotwire
reviews.text: Rated thru hotwire as a 3 star hotel comparible to Howard Johnson or a Super8. I was offered one room which was even worse and I refused it. The room I am describing is the upgraded room. Not even close it was small and dirty. No windows only a skylight with no shade or blackout curtain. Mildew in the tiles around the bathtub. The bathroom ceiling fan was completely covered in dust and dirt as shown in a submitted pic. I was locked out of my room twice in 2 days as the electric door lock battery needed to be replaced. The staff was friendly but were only there to hand out keys. The owner had to be called for any other issue. Very hard mattress. Fortunately my schedule was so busy that I basically showered and slept there. I tried to change my booking thru hotwire but they were not helpful and unwilling to change my booking or give me a credit. I will never use Hotwire again

reviews.title: Good location and excellent service.
reviews.text: It was a family trip and we stayed there for two nights. From check-in to check- out out it was a wonderful and comfortable stay. Rooms were very clean and interestingly furnished, bedding and towels were changed frequently.The hotel is situated in a great location, easy walking distance to the resort center. Kensington Market and Chinatown is in short distance. I should mention the name of that boy who personally cared for us, but unfortunately I forgot, anyway, I mean to that staffs are very professional and cooperative. We will be back next year possibly June/July

reviews.title: Avoid, avoid, avoid!
reviews.text: We booked a room here through Expedia, for two nights. We paid, and received a confirmation number, and I even called the hotel a week in advance to clarify some details and make sure everything was all set. Check-in went fine and the room was okay, except the air-conditioning was inadequate and the parking space (which cost $10 per night) was a bit on the small size.After we had already slept there for one night we were notified by front desk that we needed to vacate the room immediately so that another guest could use it. It seemed that Urban Living Suites had double-booked our room, and no other rooms were available.This wouldn't have been so bad, had it not been for the following:1) Rather than notifying us at checkout time, they waited until 3PM to notify us. We had a wedding to get to at 5PM so there was no time to arrange alternate accommodations.2) The treatment we received from the staff throughout this process was rude and unapologetic, almost to the point of being dehumanizing. Their attitude seemed to be "maybe if we stall as long as possible the problem will solve itself."As it was, my girlfriend was emotionally distraught and we had to skip the wedding and just go home. I have stayed at dozens of hotels in seven or eight countries and I have never received treatment like this.

reviews.title: Would not recommend
reviews.text: A friend booked this hotel months ago for a concert.  We were mislead by the fact that the room had 2 double beds... on arrival, there was only 1.  We were told by the hotel that we would have to buy an overnight parking permit from the city to park on the road which was fine because it was only $10.  We explained exactly where we were parked and they said it was fine.  When returning from the concert at 1:30am, we found a letter taped to the door saying we had to move the car to the right side of the road as per city bylaw.  Which would have been helpful information before we left for a concert.  There was a beautiful new TV,  with no cable.  And no phone.  Not a bad place if you're drunk, don't care,  or just want to pass out... but that is it!!! Looks like they may be making renovations, hope they get them done before word of mouth kills this business.

reviews.title: Please DO NOT GO!
reviews.text: Terrible! The worst place I have ever stayed at in the world! This hotel was not chosen by mess I was a part of a group booking for training nearby. Certainly not 3 star. Hardly a 1 star. Location - you can't find the establishment. They have two different street numbers, only a photocopied A4 sign on the wall, no visible street sign at all. In an eclectic area but a very seedy part of it. Right next door to a cannabis store! Facilities - the beds are like sleeping on a road, rooms poorly renovated and dodgey electrical fittingsNoise - expect to be disturbed by drunken parties, violent domestics. Room Service occurs randomly, not daily and beds are not touched. Don't even consider going here.

reviews.title: How are they in business?!!
reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. My husband and I stayed here for one night and we ended up sleeping in our car because of the state of the room.First off, they advertise free parking, but they don't actually offer it. After calling the hotel and arguing with the representative, we ended up having to park 3 blocks away and we had to apply for a parking permit. The customer service is terrible. The phone number on their website isn't even the right number and they have a different address listed on there as well. All in all very sketchy.When we got into our room, there were stains on the bedsheets and lamp. I made the mistake of looking under the bed only to find dust bunnies, used tissues and bugs. It was repulsive. The location of the hotel is decent. It's right beside a hospital so you can expect to hear sirens throughout the night. It's by Kensington Market and Little Italy which was the only "positive" experience. For anyone looking for a cheap deal in Toronto, I would recommend to spend the extra $30 to stay at another hotel.

reviews.title: Don't do it. Just don't.
reviews.text: This place is disgusting. Most sketchy "hotel" I've ever seen. We arrive, have to check in, in this room with a piece of paper taped to the door stating "Urban living suites" written in black marker. The family running the place barely spoke English and were also very sketchy. I asked to see my room before I gave my credit card. To see the room, we had to leave the building, walk around to a totally separate building at the back. The place was still under renovations and the exterior walls weren't bricked and there was garbage everywhere. A family happened to be standing outside their room, they must have just checked in, and the room was full of garbage and the beds and sheets were dirty. They told us, if you haven't checked in yet, leave now!We were walked through a narrow dingy hallway that smelled awful towards our room. The hallways had garbage piled up all over the floor and it reeked. She opens the door to our room and it's filthy, the dust was unreal and there were no windows. We left. I called Hotwire and asked them, is this for real? This place was listed as a 3 star... There is no way in hell.I'm pretty disappointed with Hotwire for even listing a place like this one and promoting it on their site. Especially as a 3 star.We went back into the "office" and said we weren't going to stay. They did not want to give me my information back, and kept asking me what the problem was. We took the loss as this room was prepaid through Hotwire. Words of advice. Just don't do it.

reviews.title: Horrible!
reviews.text: We booked this hotel my boyfriend and I were attending a gig across the road. We paid $100 CAD for a room that was probably about 6ft wide. There was no running hot water for showers or washing hands. Staff were very rude. We couldn't sleep due to people in corridor were being loud, yelling and stomping about! There was tea bags but no kettle to make tea. Had to ask multiple times for a hair dryer, and was asked by staff if I "really needed one" the bed was like sleeping on concrete so hard and uncomfortable, also very squeaky when you moved on it!

reviews.title: Don't Stay Here (or use Hotwire)
reviews.text: We were stuck with this room after booking on Hotwire (which I will NEVER use again to book - tried to get a refund, to no avail). This "hotel" is not anywhere near a 3 star rating.In short - it looks like an old bachelor's apartment. Shower was disgusting, bed was hard as a rock, garbage in the hallway, stains on all the furniture. If you are absolutely desperate for a room in Toronto, you may take your chances here. At least there's a roof over your head...Plus side, the location is not too bad. Heart of the city.We would never stay here again.

reviews.title: Hard to imagine this is a hotel and not a motel.
reviews.text: No hotel sign, unprofessional check in, no staff after 10pm, doorway to rooms off of street, broken tiled staircase. I booked here for one night but switched to another hotel owing to what can only be termed a misrepresentation as it was listed as a 3 star property.

reviews.title: Sketchy
reviews.text: I booked on hotwire.   This hotel was in the same category as Hilton garden inn, embassy suites, doubletree...THIS WAS NOT ANYWHERE NEAR THOSE HOTELS.As stated in the other comments.. Under construction.. No signage... No one working 24 hours ... No clocks or phones in the room...no proper computer system.. Wrote my credit card info on a sheet & pre-authorized my cc for $100 ???? The bathroom smelled like stale smoke.  Not clean looking.  The sink had hair around it that was not mine.  The kitchen stove was dirty. I felt unsafe walking up to my room.  Could hear people outside all hours of the night.I went to check out and the front door was closed to return my key and there was someone there who stated they worked there so i handed my key to him.
